titleStmt.title: Timeline of life and influence of Peter Plaoul
titleStmt.author: Jeffrey C. Witt
Eric Goddard

availability.p: Published under a Creative Commons Attribution ShareAlike 3.0 License

event.label: Born
event.desc: Peter Plaoul is born in Liege
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 418 #1521, xij.In this document from August 16th, 1385, Plaoul is identified as being 32 years old.

event.label: Trained in the cathedral school of St. Lambert
event.desc: Trained in the cathedral school of St. Lambert

event.label: Earliest point to be Licensed in arts
event.desc: October 20th, 1370 is the earliest point Plaoul could have been licensed in the arts faculty, since the source documents indicate that Plaoul was licensed in the arts faculty under chancellorship of John Caloris. Caloris was confirmed as chancellor sometime between Oct 20, 1370 and Jan 5th 1370 (CUP, p. 193 #1362), making Oct 20, 1370 the terminus a quo. It's currently unclear why Millet and Sullivan cite 1371 with such confidence since they both refer only to CUP, p. 419, #1521 which merely indicates that Plaoul was licensed under the chancellorship of Caloris. The terminus ad quem is November 17th, 1378 because Plaoul is noted as master of the arts faculty by this date. See below
event.bibl: Bernstein (1978), Pierre d'Ailly and the Blanchard Affair, p. 91

event.label: Noted as Master in the Arts Faculty in provision
event.desc: Plaoul is indeed noted as a Master of the Arts faculty in a provision granting him the expectation of a prebend in the church of St. Pierre. However, this date actually represents a nominal date indicating Plaoul's place in line to receive the prebend rather when the expectation was actually granted. See below. Thus, despite the fact that Sullivan takes this as evidence that Plaoul was a Master in the Arts faculty at this time, it more like that ms. 219, f. 210v is evidence that Plaoul was a Master in the Arts sometime between 1385 and 1387. (Again, see below)

event.label: Becomes sub-chancellor
event.desc: We surmise that Plaoul became sub-chancellor on this date because this is the data that Blanchard was given the chancellorship by Clement VII.
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 301, #1461This document, as the title indicates, is a letter from Clement VII to John Blanchard, in which Clement VII gives the chancellorship of the church of Paris (and therefore of the University of Paris) to John Blanchard "on account of his devotion" to the Avignon Pope.

event.label: Summoned to give testimony
event.desc: Plaoul is summoned by the Cardina of Laon, Peter of Montagu, acting at bequest of Clement VII, to give testimony regarding the Blanchard Affair.

event.label: Listed as sub-chancellor
event.desc: Plaoul is listed as a sub-chancellor of the University of Paris

event.label: Accused by the University of Paris
event.desc: Plaoul's, as sub-chancellor is accused of wrongdoing alongside John Blanchard
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 349 #1511This document lists articles of accusations against the chancellor of Paris (John Blanchard) on behalf of the University. In identifying the offending party, Plaoul is listed alongside Blanchard on account of being the sub-chancellor.

event.label: Listed as a MA
event.desc: Plaoul's name is listed again as a Master of the Arts Faculty
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 349 #1511Plaoul is listed as a Master in the Arts faculty

event.label: Listed as sub-chancellor
event.desc: Plaoul is listed as a sub-chancellor of the University of Paris
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 349 #1511Plaoul is listed for a second time in 1385 as sub-chancellor

event.label: Plaoul's name is listed as a Master of the Arts Faculty
event.desc: In the same document in which Plaoul is "excluded from the consortium and university congregation," he is also listed as a Master in the Art's faculty.

event.label: Plaoul is excluded from university congregation
event.desc: Plaoul is "excluded from the consortium and university congregation."
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 394 #1516As Bernstein explains, this document is evidence of disciplinary action taken by the masters of the university against everyone close to Blanchard. Bernstein translates: "In contempt of the chancellor and his office, and under the pretest of pretended abuses" runs Blanchard's complaint "the masters consider all these men excluded from the consortium and community of the university congregation"

event.label: Listed as sub-chancellor
event.desc: Plaoul is listed as a sub-chancellor of the University of Paris
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 394 #1516Here again for a third time in 1385 Plaoul is listed as sub-chancellor

event.label: Plaoul listed as a Master in the Arts Faculty
event.desc: Plaoul continues to be listed as a Master of the Arts Faculty

event.label: Becomes bachelor of theology
event.desc: Plaoul becomes bachelor of theology; probably serves as cursor
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 418 #1521, xij.This is the same document that calls Plaoul to testify regarding the Blanchard Affair from which are able to determine Plaoul's birth year. Important here is the fact that Plaoul is listed for the first time as a "bac. in theol.,"

event.label: Plaoul summoned to testify
event.desc: Plaoul summoned a second time to testify about quarrel in which he extorted money on behalf of the chancellor

event.label: Listed as sub-chancellor
event.desc: Plaoul is listed as a sub-chancellor of the University of Paris
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 418 #1521, xijHere one can see that Plaoul is identified as "subcancellarius eccl. Paris"

event.label: Received an expectation of a prebend in the church of St. Pierre in Lille
event.desc: Received an expectation of a prebend in the church of St. Pierre in Lille, which was given a nominal date of November 11, 1378, which while establishing a firm terminus a quo is less suggestive of when the expectation was given and was rather used as a way of indicating Plaoul's degree priority against other claimants to the prebend. See below for another example of this nominal dating system. For complicated reasons regarding where the supplication exists within the volume, Goddard suggests that it was most likely approved after December 10, 1385, nearly 7 years after its nominal dating. March 2nd 1387 represents a terminus ad quem since in a supplication request from this date (see below) he lists the benefices that he already holds and there includes the expectation of a prebend in the church of st. Pierre. Since he list holding the expectation on March 3rd it is almost certain that the expectation was granted prior to this date.

event.label: Provisor of the Sorbonne
event.desc: Listed in the Gallia Christiana as Provisor of the Sorbonne in 1387. But this is corroborated by no other sources and thus is very doubtful

event.label: Canon of the cathedral chapter of Senlis
event.desc: Listed in the Gallia Christiana as being a cannon in the cathedral chapter of Senlis in 1387. But this is corroborated by no other sources and thus is very doubtful.

event.label: Canon of the cathedral chapter of Paris
event.desc: Listed in the Gallia Christiana as being a cannon in the cathedral chapter of Paris in 1387. But this is corroborated by no other sources and thus is very doubtful.
event.bibl: Sullivan, "Plaoul, Petrus" Sullivan cites only Gallia Christiana here

event.label: Requests Vacant Prebend for the College at St. Omer
event.desc: Requests Vacant Prebend for the College at St. Omer; this request also confirms that he holds the expectation of a prebend at the church of St. Pierre in Lille (see above). Millet notes that a prebend at the College of St. Omer was left vacant on March 2nd, 1387 (Millet, p. 183)

event.label: Participates in University Envoy to Avignon
event.desc: In 1388, a University envoy was sent to Avignon to defend the position of the immaculate conception. Pierre d'Ailly, Gilles de Dchamps, Jean Gerson were three members of the college of Navarre that were accompanied by "Peter Plaoul, and ten doctors, a Cistersian, and a Benedictine" (Gorochov, p. 538).
event.bibl: Gorochov, Le collège de Navarre, 1997, p. 538

event.label: Plaoul requests benefices on behalf of Gilles Sansonnet
event.desc: Plaoul included the name of Gilles Sansonnet on a rotolus written by Plaoul
event.bibl: Gorochov, Le collège de Navarre, 1997, p. 699

event.label: Requests unspecified benefice
event.desc: Requests unspecified benefice; this requests confirms that he holds the previously requested prebend in St-Omer (see above). Plaoul is serving as a papal nuntius at this time, and thus is actually present at Avignon. His justification for requesting this other benefice is partly because he complains that it will be awhile before he begins to receive revenues.

event.label: Requests confirmation of accession to prebend
event.desc: Requests confirmation of accession to prebend in St-Pierre. See above for earlier expectation of this benefice.

event.label: Acts as proctor
event.desc: Acted as proctor for exchange of benefices between Pierre d'Ailly and Jean de Guignicourt; holds prend of St-Omer. Millet points out that he was criticized for wearing rich clothes although he had no outside source of income.
event.bibl: Bernstein, Pierre d'Ailly, p. 80 Though no mention is made of Plaoul, Bernstein identifies this event and explains why the event occurred. In short, the masters of the university were still unhappy with Guignicourt as chancellor of the university. Clement, therefore, permitted Guignicourt to exchange benefices with Pierre d'Ailly. Bernstein writes: "D'Ailly gave up his canonries at Amiens and Meaux in return for the chancellorshiop." (Bernstein cites CUP III, #1552 and #1553 as his source.)

event.label: Provision to parish church
event.desc: Provision to parish church of Thiberville (dioc. of Lisieux; cancelled earlier provision for church of Salmaise (Autun dioc). The Registra Avenionensia lists multiple dates making a precise dating difficult. December 11th, 1389 is the "nominal" date indicating Plaoul's level of priority with respect to other claimants to the same benefice and thus it is the terminus a quo. (See above for another example of this use of the "nominal date"). June 30th, 1391 indicates the date the benefice was actually handed over to Plaoul, making it the latest possible date that it could have been granted and the terminus ad quem.

event.label: Reads Sentences
event.desc: Plaoul serves lecturer on the Sentences (baccalaureus sententiarius)

event.label: Possibly Licensed in theology
event.desc: Plaoul is possibly licensed in theology (ranked first)
event.bibl: Millet, Pierre Plaoul, p. 185 Millet does not point to a primary source
Sullivan, Plaoul, Petrus p. 433Sullivan's source is Bnf ms lat 5657-A, f. 11r

event.label: Provisor of the Sorbonne
event.desc: Provisor of the Sorbonne

event.label: Canon of the cathedral chapter of Senlis
event.desc: The Gallia Christiana states that Plaoul was canon in the cathedral chapter of Senlis in 1393. However, it lists no primary source and Millet notes that she can find no way to verify this.
event.bibl: Sullivan, Petrus, Plaoul, 436 Sullivan states this as fact, without noting lack of verification in primary sources. His cited secondary sources are Gane and Des Graviers

event.label: Canon of the cathedral chapter of Paris
event.desc: Canon of the cathedral chapter of Paris (possibly earlier)
event.bibl: Gane, Le chapitre de Notre-Dame, p. 368, n. 518
Sullivan, Plaoul, Petrus, p. 436 Sullivan cites Gane and Des Graviers as his sources

event.label: Listed as Master of Theology
event.bibl: Millet, Pierre Plaoul, p. 85 and later in a different context on p. 86 Millet does not point to a primary source in either case, but she almost certainly has in mind the list from CUP III, p. 605, #1679

event.label: Attends University meeting to end schism
event.desc: At meeting to discuss possible ways of ending the Schism
event.bibl: CUP III, p. 605, #1679Document 1679, titled "Congregationes Universitatis Paris, post extractionem schedularum" lists the attendees at a university meeting held to discuss ways of ending the schism.google link
Swanson, Universities, p. 83Swanson discusses this event, and references the above document from the Chartularium, though he does not reference Plaoul's attendance there.

event.label: Plaoul Calls for witholding of rotulus
event.desc: Johannes Guignicourt and Pierre Plaoul call for the withheld rotulus. This date is suggested as the earliest possible since it is the date that Pope Clement VII died, and the need for a new rotulus would seem to arise with election of a new pope.
event.bibl: Millet, Pierre Plaoul p. 195Millet discusses this event here though she notes that there is an error in Froissart's dating.
Swanson, Plaoul, Petrusp. 91Swanson discusses the reluctance of Parisian masters to submit a rotolus, although he does not mention Plaoul by name.

event.label: Participates in First Clerical Assembly
event.desc: Took part in the First Clerical Assembly in favor of cession
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1840), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, II, 218-227 esp. 222 and 223google Link

event.label: Sent to Kings of Boehemia and Hungary
event.desc: Sent to the kings of Bohemia and Hungary in order to ???
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1840), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, II, pp. 416-418, esp. 416

event.label: Petitions for audience at Second Clerical Council
event.desc: Petitions for audience at Second Clerical Council
event.bibl: Vat, armar. 55, n. 46, f. 30a this manuscript is described by Ehrle on p. 194 -- need to double check manuscript reference

event.label: Speaks at the Second Clerical Council
event.desc: Plaoul speaks at the Second Clerical Council insisting on the need for withdrawal of obedience to the Avignon pope.
event.bibl: Allegaciones, ASV, Arm. 54, t. 24, fol. 252r Elie de Lestrange provides a paraphrase of Plaoul's argument -- see Kaminsky, p. 164-165
Vat, armar. 55, n. 46, f. 30b this manuscript is described by Ehrle on p. 194 -- need to double check manuscript reference
Swanson, Universities, p. 114Swanson cites Ehrle, p. 221 as his primary source

Kaminsky, Simon de Cramaud, p. 164-165 Kaminsky cites the Allegaciones of Elie de Lestrange as his primary source; he also points to Ehrle ALKG 6:222 "for a bare reference to their presentation as a speech." (Kaminsky 164, 59)

event.label: Forced by University to defend [or oppose] subtraction
event.desc: Forced by university to defend [or oppose] the substraction of obedience before the royal council on pain of being deprived of his University Status. RSD seems to suggest that Plaoul was argued in opposition withdrawal of obedience, which is in consistent with much of his other activities. However, this would explain his reluctance to accept the task given to him. Plaoul was listed as having to argue in favor of the pope; Millet suggests that this is a scribal error, but it could also be an indication that the "debate" was being stacked.
event.bibl: Auctarium Chartularii Universitatis Parisiensis, I, c. 730
Valois, III, 139, n. 1googleLinknote 2 refers to RSD II, 526, where Plaoul as listed as someone arguing against subtraction. See event 1397-02-01
Lusignan, Verite garde le roy, 184 and 201cited by Sullivan

Sullivan, 435This event is somewhat unclear in Sullivan's description. He only attaches it to the year 1396 but describes it before he describes Plaoul's speech in favor of substraction of Obedience at the Clergy Council in August 1396. But according to Valois, and through him, the Auctarium, suggest that this imposition was on Plaoul in November 20th, 1396. The royal council in question is most likely the royal council held in February of 1397 not noted by Sullivan.

event.label: Plaoul possibly licensed in theology
event.desc: Sullivan is the only who makes this suggestion based on the custom normally that a bachalarius formatus would be license five years after he read the sentences. However given the evidence that Plaoul was licensed in 1393 (see above) and appears in the Chartularium as master of theology in 1394 (see above), it seems clear that this suggestion is false.

event.label: Takes part in Royal Council Regarding Schism
event.desc: Plaoul takes part in a debate organized in the royal council regarding the schism. Plaoul was listed as having to argue in favor of the pope; Millet suggests that this is a scribal error, but it could also be an indication that the "debate" was being stacked.
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1840), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, II, p. 526

event.label: Participates in Third Clerical Assembly
event.desc: Attended Third Clerical Assembly
event.bibl: Guenee (1991), Between Church and State, 1991, p. 190

event.label: Plaoul Elected to Speak at Third Clerical Assembly
event.desc: Plaoul is one of 12 people chosen to give a speach at the Third Clerical Assembly.

event.label: Speaks on behalf of University
event.desc: Pierre Plaoul gives closing speech at third clerical assembly on behalf of the University
event.bibl: BNF, lat. ms. 14644 BNF, f. 15amansucript transcribed by Ehrle VI, 281. Ms appears to be described on p. 272 [double check]
Ehrle VI, 281googleLinkwhile the text says, June 5th, Ehrle indicates that the date was actually June 7th, the Friday after the feat of corpus christi. Ehrle does not tell us how he knows this.
Bourgeois de Chastenet, Nouvelle Histoire de Concile de Constance, pp. 61-74 googleLinkPlaoul's speech is recorded from pages 63-74

Kaminsky, Simon de Cramaud, p. 216 and p. 221On p. 216, note 29, Kaminsky provides helpful navigational descriptions of the text of Bourgeois de Chastenet. He write: "For Plaoul speech see BdeC: 64 ("mihi est injunctum, quod proponam pro totali"); the university's vote is on p. 76, and cf. p. 79)

event.label: Prepares to join embassy to Avignon
event.desc: Plaoul prepares to join embassy to Avignon headed by Louis of Orleans. It is noteworthy that Plaoul seems to have gained some respect from the Duke of Orleans despite the fact that the Duke opposed Subtraction that Plaoul Supported

event.label: Plaoul included in Christmas list of Duke of Orleans
event.desc: The Duke of Orelans included Plaoul in his Christmas list of 1398. A gift of cloth and furs was given
event.bibl: Valois III, p. 208, n. 2 google Link

event.label: Sent to Liege
event.desc: Sent to Liege to remove their obedience from the Roman pontif, Boniface IX.
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1840), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, II, p. 690

event.label: Denied vacant benefice
event.desc: Plaoul is denied reception of vacant benefice through a proctor by university rector

event.label: Plaoul receives compensation from travel
event.desc: Plaoul receives 50 "ecus" by letter from the Duke of Burgundy for travel during his trip to Liege in 1399
event.bibl: Bibl. nat., collection de Bourgogne, ms. 65, fol. 73v

event.label: Heads Embassy to Pope Innocent VII
event.desc: Headed embassy to pope Innocent VII
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1841), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, III, p. 360
Valois, Schisme III, pp. 424-425google LinkIt's difficult to find Plaoul's name on either p. 424 or 425. What in Valois makes this connection?
Meyjes (1999), Jean Gerson Apostle of Unity, p. 119 Meyjes cites Valois III, p. 422, n. 5, pp. 423-6 as source for entire discussion

event.label: Present at Paris return books and library key
event.desc: Plaoul returns 30 books and the library key to the Library at the College of the Sorbonne.
event.bibl: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, ms. 3323, f. 30rThis has been transcribed in Vielleard, p. 194-195
Vielliard, Le Registre de Prêt, pp. 194-195this is a transcription of ms. 3323, f. 30r

event.label: Returns library books, retains other and the key
event.desc: Returns all "cancelled" books, but keeps others as well as the library key
event.bibl: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, ms. 3323, f. 30rThis has been transcribed in Vielleard, p. 195
Vielliard, Le Registre de Prêt, p. 195this is a transcription of ms. 3323, f. 30r

event.label: Returns Library Book and Key
event.desc: Returns all books and a key; a key which was previously in the possession of Johannes de Atrio
event.bibl: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, ms. 3323, f. 30rThis has been transcribed in Vielleard, p. 195
Vielliard, Le Registre de Prêt, p. 195this is a transcription of ms. 3323, f. 30r

event.label: Re-borrows books and keys
event.desc: Present again in Paris to re-borrow books and key
event.bibl: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, ms. 3323, f. 30rThis has been transcribed in Vielleard, p. 195
Vielliard, Le Registre de Prêt, p. 195this is a transcription of ms. 3323, f. 30r

event.label: Seeks Condemnation of Letter from Univ of Toulouse
event.desc: Plaoul along with Jean Petit emerge as the spokesmen for a policy of renewed subtraction from Benedict. Their first task was to speak before Parliament of Paris and ask (successfully) for the condemnation of an anti-subtractionist letter published by the University of Toulouse
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1841), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, III, pp. 376-377
Tuetey, Journal de Nicolas de Bay: Greffier du Parelement de Paris 1400-1417 (NdB) 1:157-159googleLinkThe May 27th Assembly is recorded here, by Plaoul's name is not mentioned.

Gallia Christiana X, p. 1432GoogleLinkThe text notes that two orations given by Plaoul in 1406 can be found in the library of the college of St. Victor. The text indicates that these orations were given on behalf of the University of Paris at a meeting of important French dignitaries. The mention of two different orations probably refers to two different speeches, the first one from May and the second one from June.
Ouy Manuscrites, 2:314Note sure what this is but it was included in the table of dates

event.label: Plaoul seeks support from Parliament for subtraction
event.desc: Only a short while after asking Parliament to condemn the anti-subtractionist letter of the University of Toulouse, Plaoul, along with Jean Petit, goes before Parliament again to ask for support for the renewed policiy of subtraction
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1841), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, III, p. 376 googleLink
Tuetey, Journal de Nicolas de Bay: Greffier du Parelement de Paris 1400-1417 (NdB) I, 159googleLink

Gallia Christiana X, p. 1432GoogleLinkThe text notes that two orations given by Plaoul in 1406 can be found in the library of the college of St. Victor. The text indicates that these orations were given on behalf of the University of Paris at a meeting of important French dignitaries. The mention of two different orations probably refer to the two different speeches, the first one from May and the second one from June.

event.label: Speaks at Fourth Clerical Assembly
event.desc: Plaoul is one of three spokesmen for the University's policy of subtraction: the other two speakers were Jean Petit and Simon de Cramaud. Plaoul argued that the Schism was a 'violent thing' and its solution required going beyond the 'order of law.'
event.bibl: Bulaeus, Historia Universitatis Parisiensis, 1670, V, p. 133
Bourgeois de Chastenet, Nouvelle Histoire de Concile de Constance, 177-189googleLinkIt is from this speech that we learn that Plaoul was from Liege, see Millet, 180
Rashdall, The Universities of Europe, 1895, p. 548, n. 4 GoogleLink Rashdall source is Bulaeus, V. p. 132
Coville (1932), Jean Petit, p. 73 It is currently to identify the source Coville is using
Kaminsky, Simon de Cramaud, 117n23, 165n63, 265-266 In 117n23 and 165n63 citations, Kaminsky points to BdeC, p. 192f, but I have listed 177-189. There may be mistake here.
Guenee (1991), Between Church and State, 1991 p. 205Guenee's source is Coville, Jean Petit, 73-80 (the reference appears to happen directly on p. 73

event.label: Returns all library books with key
event.desc: Returns all library books with key [and John de Atrio "has those without the acquisition of law." Date is not precise, manuscript stats 1407 on the 22nd day but does not give month. We assume it cannot be after May 1407 since it was in main that he joined the embassy to Rome.
event.bibl: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, ms. 3323, f. 30rThis has been transcribed in Vielleard, p. 195
Vielliard, Le Registre de Prêt, p. 195this is a transcription of ms. 3323, f. 30r

event.label: Participates in Embassy to Rome
event.desc: Part of important Embassy to Marseille (to see Benedict XIII) and then Rome (to see Gregory XII). Guenee describes the even this way: "plans were made to send an embasssy to Marseille, where Benedict XIII was staying, and then on to Rome to see Gregory XII, in the hope that this might facilitate the double abdication. This important embassy involved thirty-six individuals, an unusually large number" (Guenee, pp. 208-209)
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1841), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, III, pp. 510-520, esp. p. 514googleLink
Monstrelet, CEM, I, p. 146-151 googleLinkThe same embassy is described by Monstrelet, though--as noted by Valois--only a few ambassadors are named and Plaoul is not one of them.
Valois III, 499, n. 6; googleLinkThis text is referenced by Sullivan as p. 409, n. 6, but it is actually p. 499, n. 6
Guenee, Between Church and State, 1991, p. 209 Guenee cites RSD III, pp. 512-515 and Valois, La France, III, p. 499 as sources
Sullivan, 436 there is an error in Sullivan's citation to Valois. The note number 6 that he references is on p. 499 not p. 409

event.label: Participates in embassy to Pope Benedict
event.desc: Plaoul is part of an embassy to Pope Benedict, where he does no serve as a spokesman and is forced to show elaborate respect to the Pontiff. This is undoubtedly an awkward moment for Plaoul who only months before argued forcefully for the subtraction of obedience to Pope Benedict.
event.bibl: Gallia Christiana X, 1431GoogleLinkThis text suggests the year 1408.
Valois, III, p. 510 GoogleLinkValois must have a primary source for this, but it is difficulty to identify.
Boussuat, "une relation inedite", 99not sure what this is, but it was included in table of dates, could it be a primary source

event.label: On embassy to Rome, Plaoul Addresses Pope Gregory XII
event.desc: The embassy to Rome moves on from the court of Benedict to the court of Pope Gregory XII. The goal of this meeting was to arrange a colloquy between the two rival pontiffs. Here, Plaoul resumed his usual role as spokesman for the University. He gave a sermon before the Pope in favor or the via cessionis. The theme of the sermon was "domine, dabis pacem nobis"
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1841), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, III, pp. 650-654, esp. p. 650 google Link
Gallia Christiana X, 1431GoogleLinkThis text suggests the year 1408

event.label: Plaoul Present in Italy
event.desc: Pierre Plaoul was still in Italy with another University spokesman, Simon de Cramaud. During that time both masters were probably present at the defection of the majority of the Roman college of cardinals from Gregory in May 1408 and definitely served as facilitators and witnesses for the merger of the two colleges of cardinals in June of that year
event.bibl: J. Vincke, Briefe zum Pisaner Konzil, n. 15

event.label: Present at the Union of the two colleges of cardinals
event.desc: He was present at the union of the two colleges of cardinals; he was among the Frenchman excommunicated by Benedict XIII (cf. ?)
event.bibl: Kaminsky, Simon de Cramaud, p. 279 Kaminsky cites Martene, VII, 798-803 as his source

event.label: Plaoul Returns to Paris and Rejoins Fifth Clerical Council
event.desc: Plaoul (and Cramaud) have returned to Paris by this time and are therefore able to be present at the Fifth Assembly of the French Clergy. The focus of this assembly was on dealing with the aftermath of France's own declaration of neutrality with regard to both popes in May 1408, a move that laid the groundwork for the French support of the Council of Pisa.
event.bibl: Monstrelet, La chronique d'Enguerrand de Monstrelete, (possibly Bibliotheque imperiale n. 8345, and 8346) (see d'Arcq, p. xiv, for description of various manuscripts)

d'Arcq (ed.), La chronique d'Enguerrand de Monstrelet I, p. 349 GoogleLinkThis document from the chronicles of Monstrelet indicates that Plaoul with Cramaud returned to Paris and were present at the 5th Clerical Council. It also states that Plaoul and Cremaud were previously in Italy as ambassadors of the King of France and the University of Paris

Bulaeus, 1670, Historia Universitatis Parisiensis.p. 189Bulaeus appears to be relying on the chronicle of Monstrelet. He writes: Simon Cramaudus et Petrps Plaoul, eorum reditus Ecclesiae Gall. Praelatis tunc congregatis gratissimus acceptissimusque fuit, ut narrat Monstreletius." A quotation from Monstrelet then appears to followgoogleLink

event.label: Named as representative to the Council of Pisa
event.desc: Plaoul is named as a representative to the Council of Pisa
event.bibl: Turin, Archivio di Stato, Protocollo ducale, n. 2, f. 58r, l. 348 This list is transcribed and edited by Millet, 1981
Mansi, Amplissima Collectio, XXVII, col. 341 This source was mentioned by Millet, 1981
Mansi, Amplissima Collectio, XXVI, col. 1247 This seems to be the same list seen in Bulaeus and in Millet, but it does not seem to correspond to the reference in Millet 1981 to Mansi XXVII 341.

Bulaeus, (1670), Historida Universitatis Parisiensis, Bulaeus is quoting a letter which he attributes to the rector of the university but gives no source. The list of name closely approximates the list of names noted by Helene Millet. But it is not yet clear whether they are using the same source or whether Bulaeus is quoting from a document distinct from the Turin manuscript. googleLink

Millet (1981), "Pères du concile", p. 752 Millet's source is the Turin manuscript but she notes parallel references to Plaoul in Mansi, Sacrorum conciliorum nova et amplissima collectio XXVII, 1784, col. 331-356, col. 341 and ms Vat Lat. 4000, p. 101v
Sullivan, "Plaoul, Petrus", p. 436 Sullivan cites Jourdain and Millet as sources

event.label: Arrives at Council of Pisa
event.desc: Arrives at Council of Pisa

event.label: Preaches before the Council of Pisa
event.desc: This could be considered one of the pinnacle moments of Plaoul's career. Plaoul delivered a sermon at the 13th session of the council of Pisa in front of an audience of more than 100 theologians. It likely that the new Pontiff chosen by the council was pleased with what Plaoul had to say because in June of the same year this pope, Alexander V, appointed Plaoul Bishp of Senlis
event.bibl: Hermann von der Hardt, Res concilii oecumenici Constantiensis, 1687, II, col. 132 GoogleLink This source is used by Figueiredo
Figueiredo, Tentativa theologica, 1847, p. 158 GoogleLinkCites Hardt as source

event.label: Becomes Bishop of Senlis
event.desc: Named Bishop of Senlis by Pope Alexander V, the new pope chosen by the Council of Pisa
event.bibl: Eubel, Hierarchia catholica medii aevi, I, p. 452 there may be an older edition of this from 1898, wherein the same piece of information is found on p. 476
Gane, Le chapitre de Notre-Dame, p. 368, n. 518

event.label: Writes to University about Death of Alexander V
event.desc: Plaoul writes the university informing of the death of Alex. V and the failure to sign rotulus
event.bibl: Chron. de Jean Brandon, ed Kervyn de Lettenhove in Chron, relatives a l'hist. de la Belgique (1870), I, p. 135 sq.This is the letter referenced by Denifle in the Chartularium. It is perserved in the chronicles compiled by John Brandon.

CUP IV, 178, #1881Denifle notes a letter written to the university by Peter Plaoul. The letter is preserved and recorded by the Chronicler Jean Brandon and has been edited and published by Kervyn de Lettenhove (1870).

event.label: Speaks before the English-German nation
event.desc: He speaks before the English-German nation as part of a delegation of the Cardinal Adimari
event.bibl: Gallia Christiana X, 1431GoogleLinkthis text states that Plaoul, with the Archbishop of Pisa, sent by John XXIII to speak at the University of Paris and that they were heard on November 13, 1410

event.label: Enters into his See at Senlis
event.desc: He enters into his see at Senlis

event.label: Borrows books from College of Chollets
event.desc: Borrows 18 volumes from the college of Chollets

event.label: Present at University Assembly
event.desc: Present at an Assembly where the University of Paris revindicated its access to papal provision

event.label: Has key with the consent of the Lord Provisor [?et aule prius habito?]
event.desc: Has key with the consent of the Lord Provisor [?et aule prius habito?]
event.bibl: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, ms. 3323, f. 47rThis has been transcribed in Vielleard, p. 195
Vielliard, Le Registre de Prêt, p. 195this is a transcription of ms. 3323, f. 47r

event.label: Reims manuscript of Sentences copied by scribe
event.desc: the inscription on an inside flap of the codex reads: "Difficultates[?] theologicas[?] Philippi Padua[?] et Petri Plaoul Episcopi Silvanectensis Super fide catholica. / Datur [?] hic liber ab Aegidio de Aspivomoul - die May 18 anno domini 1412"

event.label: Sent to Auxerre
event.desc: One of twelve representatives sent to Auxerre to discuss the peace of the kingdom
event.bibl: Bellaguet (1842), Chronique du religieux de Saint-Denys, IV, p. 440 googleLinkThis document contains both a Latin and French version, wherein Plaoul is identified as the Bishop of Senlis. The beginning of the document indicates that the King called many secret meetings to reconcile the conflict of many ducs and that finally at the end of July he assembled another meeting in Auxerre to which Plaoul was sent. [not clear to me where it say that this meeting was to take place in Auxerre

event.label: University asks Plaoul to accept office of protector of the privileges of the University
event.desc: University asks Plaoul to accept office of protector of the privileges of the University. This date is uncertain. Denifle says anytime after Aug 1412 to 1420. The latter date, of course, is not possible since Plaoul died in 1415

event.label: Serves as provisor of the College de Sorbonne
event.desc: Serves as provisor of the College de Sorbonne
event.note: could this be related 1412-04-30 and Plaoul receiving key with the consent of the provisor

event.label: Gives gifts to the Sorbonne
event.desc: Left to the Sorbonne a Bible with concordances, Albert the Great's Commentary on the Sentences, earning himself commemorative portrait

event.label: Dies
event.desc: Peter Plaoul Dies
event.bibl: ms. Reims f. 213vbThis epitaph added to the penultimate page of the Reims ms. after Plaoul's death reads "obiit ?dictum? magister petrus plaoul episcopus Silvanectem parum[?] die XI mensis aprilis anno domini MCCCCXV, anima eius in pace requiescat, amen." or Master Plaoul, Bishop of Senlis, on the 11th day of the month of april in the year of our Lord 1415. May his soul rest in peace, amen.
H. Finke, Acta concilii Constanciensis, 4 vols., Munster, 1896-1928, t. 3, p. 216-217
A. Longnon, Obituaires de la province de Sens, t. 1, 740
Gallia Christiana X, 1431GoogleLinkThis text suggest that Plaoul was buried next to Peter Lombard, Bishop of Paris

event.label: Johannes de Attrio returns the Late Plaoul's Library key
event.desc: Johannes de Attrio returns the Late Plaoul's Library key
event.bibl: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, ms. 3323, f. 47rThis has been transcribed in Vielleard, p. 195
Vielliard, Le Registre de Prêt, p. 195this is a transcription of ms. 3323, f. 47r

event.label: Plaoul referenced in the margins of the Sentences Commentary of Lambertus de Monte
event.desc: Plaoul repeated appears in the margins of the Sentences Commenatry of Lambertus de Monte written in 1423. Lambertus appears to be citing Plaoul from ms. E
event.bibl: Biblioteque Royale de Belgique, 760, 1715, C (or Bruxelles, KB 760), f. 8r, f. 12r, f. 25r, f. 26r, f. 71v Thanks to Mario Meliado for this intial list [could there be more??]

Mario Meliadò and Silvia Negri, "Neues zum Pariser Albertismus des frühen 15. Jahrhunderts. Der Magister Lambertus de Monte und die Handschrift Bruxelles, KB 760" Bulletin de philosophie médiévale 53/2011

event.label: MS VP is gifted to the Library at the University of Heidelberg
event.desc: Henricus de Gouda bequeaths to the University of Heidelberg several books, one of which is ms VP containing Plaoul's Commentary on the Sentences
event.bibl: AU II, 72 this is cited by Toepke, but not by Maier
Die matrikel der Universitat Heidelberg, 693, n. 855googleLink
Maier, Zu einigen Sentenzenkommentaren des XIV Jahrhundert, 405-409, esp. 406

event.label: Plaoul's Sentences checked out by Henricus de Quesnayo
event.desc: Plaoul's Sentences checked out by Henricus de Quesnayo. Ms should read "conformes" on second folio and "et causa est" on penultimate folio
event.bibl: Paris, Bibliothèque Mazarine, ms. 3323, f. 120vThis has been transcribed in Vielleard, p. 432
Vielliard, Le Registre de Prêt, doss. 113, a. 4, p. 432this is a transcription of ms. 3323, f. 120v
Kaluza, "Les débuts de l'Albertisme tardif (Paris et Cologne)," p. 287

event.desc: Plaoul's Sentences renewed by Henricus de Quesnayo

Vielliard, Le Registre de Prêt, doss. 113, a. 4, p. 432this is a transcription of ms. 3323, f. 120v

event.desc: Plaoul's Sentences checked out by Johannes Cordier. Second folio reads "conformes nec" and penultimate folio reads "fuit ideo sub quacumque quantitate"

event.desc: Plaoul's Sentences checked out by Cornelius Audendick. Second folio reads "conformans" and penultimate folio reads "pulcherrima"

event.desc: Plaoul's Sentences checked out by Johannes Lalier. Second folio reads "conformes" and penultimate folio reads "et eam" or "et causa"
